name: Categorize and Label Existing Gmail Emails Automatically with GPT-4o mini

parameters.content:
## 1. Manual Trigger + Gmail Fetch + Label Checker
[Read more about Manual Trigger node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.manualworkflowtrigger/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.manualTrigger)
[Read more about Gmail Get node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/draft-operations/#get-many-drafts)
[Read more about Filter node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.filter/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.filter)

üñ±Ô∏è Manual inbox processing

This section starts the workflow manually with a click, allowing you to process a batch of existing emails already in your Gmail inbox.
It fetches a defined number of messages (default: 50) and uses a Filter node to skip emails that already have labels ‚Äî ensuring only unlabeled emails are passed to AI.
You can adjust the number of emails to fetch by changing the limit in the Gmail node.

## üì® Categorize and Label Existing Gmail Emails Automatically with GPT-4o mini

## üë• Who's it for

This workflow is perfect for individuals or teams who want to sort and label existing emails in their Gmail inbox üóÉÔ∏è using AI. Ideal for cleaning up unlabeled emails in bulk ‚Äî no coding required!

For sorting incoming emails messages in your gmail inbox, please use this free workflow: [Categorize and Label Incoming Gmail Emails Automatically with GPT-4o mini](https://n8n.io/workflows/5595-categorize-and-label-gmail-emails-automatically-with-gpt-4o-mini/)

## ü§ñ What it does

It manually processes a selected number of existing Gmail emails, skips those that already have labels, sends the content to an AI Agent powered by GPT-4o mini üß†, and applies a relevant Gmail label based on the email content. All labels must already exist in Gmail.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Manual Trigger ‚Äì The workflow starts manually when you click "Execute Workflow".

üì• Gmail Get Many Messages ‚Äì Pulls a batch of existing inbox emails (default: 50).

üö´ Filter ‚Äì Skips emails that already have one or more labels.

üß† AI Agent (GPT-4o mini) ‚Äì Analyzes the content and assigns a category.

üßæ Structured Output Parser ‚Äì Converts the AI output into structured JSON.

üîÄ Switch Node ‚Äì Routes each email to the right label based on the AI result.

üè∑Ô∏è Gmail Nodes ‚Äì Apply the correct Gmail label to the email.

## üìã Requirements

Gmail account connected to n8n

Gmail labels must be manually created in your inbox beforehand

Labels must exactly match the category names defined in the AI prompt

OpenAI credentials with GPT-4o mini access

n8n's AI Agent & Structured Output Parser nodes

## üõ†Ô∏è How to set up

In your Gmail account, create all the labels you want to use for categorizing emails

Open the workflow and adjust the email fetch limit in the Gmail node (e.g., 50, 100)

Confirm that the Filter skips emails that already have labels

Define your categories in the AI Agent prompt ‚Äî these must match the Gmail labels exactly

In the Switch Node, create a condition for each label/category

Ensure each Gmail Label Node applies the correct existing label

Save the workflow and run it manually whenever you want to organize your inbox ‚úÖ

## üé® How to customize the workflow
Add or remove categories in the AI prompt & Switch Node

Adjust the batch size of emails to process more or fewer per run

Fine-tune the AI prompt to suit your inbox type (e.g., work, personal, client support)

## 2. AI Categorization + Structured Output

[Read more about AI Agent node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/root-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=%40n8n%2Fn8n-nodes-langchain.agent)
[Read more about Structured Output Parser node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.outputparserstructured/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=%40n8n%2Fn8n-nodes-langchain.outputParserStructured)

üß† Analyze and extract label

This section uses an AI Agent powered by GPT-4o mini to analyze the subject and body of each email and determine the appropriate label based on your custom prompt.
The AI's response is parsed by the Structured Output Parser, which converts it into clean JSON like:
{ "email_label": "work" }
Make sure the categories returned match exactly with the Gmail labels you've already created.

## 3. Apply labels based on AI output
[Read more about Switch node editing](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.switch/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.switch)
[Read more about Gmail node editing](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations/#add-label-to-a-message)

üè∑Ô∏è Apply labels based on AI output
The Switch node uses email_label from the AI response to route each email to the correct label path.
Each branch corresponds to one category.
Then, each Gmail node applies the label that matches the category.
‚ö†Ô∏è Make sure each route and label name matches exactly.

options.systemMessage:
=**Your Role**

You are an intelligent email assistant responsible for sorting incoming messages. Your task is to analyze the content, subject, and sender of each email and assign it to the appropriate category.

**Categories**

Categories for sorting:

-Work: Emails related to jobs, coworkers, meetings, projects, or professional tasks.

-Personal: Messages from friends, family, or general personal life content.

-Finance: Bank emails, invoices, receipts, bills, or payment confirmations.

-Shopping: Order confirmations, promotions, receipts, or product updates from stores.

-Travel: Booking confirmations, tickets, hotel or car rental details, itineraries.

-Newsletters: Recurring marketing or informational emails from subscriptions or blogs.

-Others: Relevant emails that don‚Äôt clearly fit into any of the categories above.

**Instructions**

-For each email:

-Analyze the content, subject, and sender

-Assign it to the appropriate category

-Add a label with the category

-If you are unsure, do not label the message

**Response Format**

Always return the result in JSON format:

{
  "email_label": "Shopping"
}

IMPORTANT ‚Äì the response must use the exact label format as listed (capitalized with spaces).
